marketNews.title: Pemilu Diproyeksikan 1 Putaran, IHSG Perkasa
marketNews.content: Presidential and vice-presidential candidate pair, Prabowo Subianto and Gibran Rakabuming Raka, obtained 56-59% of the vote in the 2024 election, based on quick count results from several survey institutions. Meanwhile, the KPU real count results as of Thursday (15/2) afternoon showed that their vote acquisition was 56.32% out of 43.93% of the votes already counted. Although the calculation results are still preliminary, this large vote difference indicates that the election will most likely be concluded in one round only. These results were welcomed positively by market players and foreign investors, with the IHSG rising +1.3% to the level of 7,303 on Thursday (15/2), where 10 out of 11 sectors strengthened. Based on the preliminary quick count results from Litbang Kompas as of Thursday (15/2), several parties included in the coalition supporting Prabowo-Gibran obtained more than 4% of the vote and are projected to pass into parliament. These parties consist of Golkar (14.47%), Gerindra (13.58%), Demokrat (7.59%), and PAN (7.1%). The total vote share of these four only reached 42.74% and did not reach 50%. PDI-P - which supports candidate pair Ganjar Pranowo and Mahfud MD - obtained the largest legislative election vote share with a result of 16.97%, based on the Litbang Kompas quick count. PDI-P is the only supporting party for Ganjar-Mahfud to obtain more than 4% of the vote. Meanwhile, the 3 supporting parties for Anies Baswedan and Muhaimin Iskandar each received more than 4% of the vote, with PKB at 11.29%, Nasdem at 9.42%, and PKS at 8.36%. Key Takeaway. Various sectors and stocks potentially benefiting from these presidential election results are: Sectors related to Prabowo-Gibran's program plans: Free milk program: ULTJ, CMRY Continuation of the IKN project: PTPP, ADHI, ACST, PANI, PWON Continuation of downstreaming: ANTM, INCO, NCKL Big banks which received foreign inflow: BBCA, BBRI, BMRI, and BBNI. However, it should be noted that these stocks have already received significant foreign fund inflows and their valuations are no longer cheap. Stocks whose shareholders are considered by the market to have affiliations with the Prabowo-Gibran supporting coalition: ADRO, ADMR, MDKA, MBMA, TRIM, ABBA, and MARI. Although the market appears enthusiastic in welcoming the preliminary calculation results, it is important to remember that the impact of this positive sentiment may not last long. Therefore, investors must remain attentive to the fundamentals and valuations of each company. Furthermore, the effectiveness of the new government's decision-making in implementing its programs will depend on the success of the coalition supporting Prabowo-Gibran in embracing other parties in the DPR, considering that the share of votes held by its supporting coalition is still below 50%.

marketNews.title: US Inflation in January 2024
marketNews.content: The US recorded inflation of 3.1% YoY in January 2024 (vs. Dec 2023: 3.4% YoY inflation), exceeding consensus expectations at the level of 2.9% YoY. On a monthly basis, inflation reached 0.3% MoM (vs. Dec 2023: 0.2% YoY inflation), exceeding consensus expectations at the level of 0.2% MoM. Core inflation in January 2024 reached 3.9% YoY, unchanged from December 2023, but still higher than consensus expectations at the level of 3.7% YoY.

marketNews.title: Indonesia's Trade Balance Surplus in January 2024
marketNews.content: BPS recorded that Indonesia's trade balance surplus in January 2024 decreased to the level of US$2.02 billion (vs. Jan 2023: US$3.88 billion), lower than the consensus expectation which projected a surplus of US$2.99 billion. This is the smallest trade balance surplus since July 2023. Exports fell -8.06% YoY to the level of US$20.52 billion, marking the lowest level in the last 8 months. Meanwhile, imports rose +0.36% YoY to the level of US$18.51 billion.

marketNews.title: Japan Officially Enters Recession
marketNews.content: Japan officially entered a recession after GDP in 4Q23 contracted by -0.4% YoY (vs. 3Q23: -3.3% YoY), far below the consensus expectation which predicted growth of +1.4% YoY.

marketNews.title: Asia's Thermal Coal Imports Decline in January 2024
marketNews.content: Commodity analysis firm, Kpler, reported that coal imports in Asia fell -5% MoM in January 2024 to the level of 77.65 million tons. The realization was suppressed by decreased demand from China and India, which are the two largest coal importers in the world.

marketNews.title: Bitcoin Price Surpasses $50,000
marketNews.content: The price of Bitcoin broke the $50,000 level on Tuesday (13/2) for the first time since December 2021. Since the beginning of the year, the price of Bitcoin has strengthened by more than +17% YTD, driven by the approval by the US capital market regulator, The Securities and Exchange Commission, of Bitcoin-based exchange-traded funds (ETFs) in January 2024.

tickerNews.title: BJTM to Distribute Dividends with 7.9% Yield
tickerNews.content: Bank Pembangunan Daerah Jawa Timur will distribute 2023 book year dividends amounting to 816.69 billion rupiah or 54.39 rupiah per share. The cum dividend date in the regular and negotiation markets is February 20, 2024, with payment on March 7, 2024. Referring to the BJTM share price at the market close on Thursday (15/2) at 690 rupiah per share, the indicated dividend yield is 7.9%.

tickerNews.title: Gudang Garam Establishes Toll Road Company
tickerNews.content: Gudang Garam established a toll road company named PT Surya Sapta Agung Tol (SSAT), which will build the Kediri-Tulungagung toll road project. The company was established together with the controller of the corporation, PT Suryaduta Investama, with placed and fully paid-up capital of 2 trillion rupiah. GGRM's ownership in SSAT reaches 99.9%.

tickerNews.title: GoTo Management Denies Rumors of Merger with Grab
tickerNews.content: GoTo Gojek Tokopedia management told the IDX that the company cannot comment on rumors related to a merger with Grab Holdings Ltd. (Nasdaq: GRAB), as reported by Bloomberg last week. GOTO management also stated that there are no discussions related to this matter at the present time.

tickerNews.title: CCSI Plans Rights Issue with Up to 12% Dilution
tickerNews.content: Communication Cable Systems Indonesia plans to hold a rights issue of up to 163.6 million (13.6%) new shares with a dilution effect of up to 12%. The ratio and exercise price have not yet been announced, while the funds obtained are intended for working capital. This plan will be discussed in the Extraordinary General Meeting of Shareholders (RUPSLB) on March 22, 2024.

tickerNews.title: FAP Agri Controller Sells Shares Causing Ownership Decrease
tickerNews.content: The controller of FAP Agri, Prinsep Management Limited, sold 18.9 million FAPA shares at a price of 5,300 rupiah per share on January 26 and February 5, 2024. The total transaction value reached 100.2 billion rupiah. After this transaction, Prinsep Management Limited's ownership in FAPA decreased from 75.79% to 75.27%.
